pages.text: As you've probably learned, Vampires don't just drink blood for fun. They need it to survive! Blood is the source of a vampire's power, and without it, they will weaken and slip into a lifeless, desiccated state. Without regular feeding, a vampire will eventually weaken and become a mummified shell.

pages.name: Feeding
pages.text: $(6)🩸 Feeding Mechanics: Staying Alive by Draining Life$()$(br2)To feed, a vampire must find a living creature and use the blood suck keybind ($(k:maleficium.suck_blood)).$(br2)Activating this keybind causes the vampire to begin feeding, $(o)replenishing their blood level$()—the source of their strength and survival.

$(6)🩸 Feeding Mechanics: How It Works$()$(br2)While feeding, the target will be $(o)incapacitated briefly$(), unable to move or fight back.$(br)$(li)Press the key once to feed a single time.$(br)$(li)Hold the key to feed continuously until you're satisfied—or the target runs dry.$(br2)

$(6)🩸 Feeding Mechanics: How It Works$()$(br2)Feeding does not work on undead creatures,$() such as zombies or skeletons. Only $(1)living creatures$() offer the nourishing blood your vampire body needs.$(br2)Go to the next page for more info on which mobs make the most satisfying meals.

pages.title: Players
pages.text: Players are easily the most satisfying meals for vampires, but also the most dangerous.

pages.name: Villagers
pages.text: Villagers are among the best sources of blood for vampires, providing more blood than most other mobs.
